editorial_summary.overview: Contemporary lodging offering bright rooms & suites with free Wi-Fi, plus a trendy bar.

formatted_address: Via Pietro Orseolo, 1, 20144 Milano MI, Italy
name: Mercure Milano Solari

plus_code.compound_code: F549+JC Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text:
We stayed in this hotel twice in June 2025. It is located in one of the backstreets but with the Metro and tram stops nearby. The apartments we stayed were well equipped with a kitchenette and one of them even with the washing machine. The rooms were air-conditioned and generally clean and good. However, the standard of housekeeping was disappointing during our two stays. During our first three-nights-day, the housekeeping was not done until we hurried them at 5 pm in the afternoon. Moreover, irritating issues like washing gel in the bathroom had long been used up without having replaced, not to say the washing powder. So, we have to prepare these basic utensils for our own use. Worst came during our second stay. We arrived at the hotel slightly before 2 pm, and was told that the room would not be not ready until 3 pm. So we went out for a walk during the very hot weather, and returned to the hotel, soaking, at 3pm, only to know that the rooms were still not ready because of the housekeeping. The seating area at the reception was very small, and there were full of people waiting for their rooms to be ready. We stood for a while in the lobby, having nowhere to sit, and wondered what had happened to the household management of the hotel. The staff at the reception was nice enough to open the Hotel restaurant for us to have a seat. (The restaurant was only opened during breakfast and after 5 pm). He was nice enough to listen to our complaint and offered us a bottle of water while we waited for our apartment to be cleaned. We managed to check in after 3:30 pm. But while we walked past the lobby, it was still full of people waiting for their rooms to be cleaned.

To conclude, the hotel was nice for a one night stay, especially when you know you will check in late. Otherwise, I guess there are a lot of other hotels in the town that have rooms available on time.

Parking is not on site. It is valet parking and cost €32 per 24 hours. Extra parking time costs €20.

Worst hotel in twrms of facility, it should not be 4 star hotel or a member in ALL, i booked a suite and it was awful: walls not painted, bathroom very old and dropping water from the ceiling, towels were dirty, AC condition was not working properly, terrace table and chairs were dirty and old you can't sit on them. The only excptional positive thing about the hotel is one of their staff Gigi who tried his best to solve our issues but all rooms and apartments were in similar condition. Also they claimed that normsl check out is at 10am which was the strangest thing i heard in my life and because I am a gold member of ALL they extended my check out till 12pm !!!!

Hotel is in a very nice district, easy to reach by foot with public transportation. Rooms are very comfortable, and very quiet, bed are very good. All is very clean.
Rooms are a bit old fashion and could be refreshed.

Absolutely Horrible Stay – Not Worth 4 Stars!

I don’t even know where to begin. This was by far one of the worst hotel stays I’ve ever experienced. First of all, the bed sheets were clearly not clean, and the furniture and curtains were extremely old and worn out – nothing like the pictures online. To make it worse, they don’t even offer complimentary water, which is shocking for a so-called 4-star hotel.

When I first entered the room, I found leftovers in the fridge – clearly showing the room hadn’t been cleaned properly. The AC was not working during a heatwave, and despite reporting it every single day, no one did anything about it. The level of neglect is unbelievable.

This hotel is a complete disappointment. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. They seriously need to reconsider their star rating – this place barely qualifies for 2 stars.

I recently stayed at the Mercure Milano Solari during my first trip to Milan. As an Accor member, I was familiar with the brand and chose this spot. While it’s not right in the city center near the Duomo, the location is surprisingly convenient. The Agostino train station is just a short walk away, making it easy to get around the city. The neighborhood itself is pretty nice, with some good cafes and minimarkets right nearby.

Overall, the hotel felt a bit below the typical Mercure standard I’m used to, but the price was definitely fair, especially compared to other hotels in Milan. The room was perfectly adequate; it wasn't super small and had everything we needed. It was a comfortable base for our trip and felt like a good value for the cost.

The service, though, really stood out. Daniela at the front desk was fantastic. Her hospitality was exceptional. We arrived well before our scheduled check-in time, and she was incredibly helpful, letting us use a meeting room for several hours until our room was ready. That kind of gesture makes a huge difference and really made our arrival stress-free.
